instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: When replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> does not work.
threads.message: Had a couple of bords come back after replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>. Replaced with larger non tant caps 2v 330uF but still getting shutdowns.... They are from donor boards though.

threads.title: When replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> does not work.
threads.message: Yeah hopeless garbage. Replace the GPU and also the VRAM if it is Samsung, but expect returns regardless.

threads.title: When replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> does not work.
threads.message: Not a chance. Think I'll just refuse them.

threads.title: When replacing <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> does not work.
threads.message: Still most of them will be fine with <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, so I just refund the ones that come back.
